IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To provide instruction and to further the conservation and preservation of natural assets and resources at various locations within Maine.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE INSTRUCTION AND TO FURTHER THE CONSERVATION AND PRESERVATION OF NATURAL ASSETS AND RESOURCES AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS WITHIN MAINE.
IRS990.Description: SUMMER PROGRAMS - PROVIDE SUMMER CAMP ACTIVITIES FOR BOYS AND GIRLS, SERVING ROUGHLY 480 STUDENTS PER YEAR.

Activity2.Description: ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAM - PROVIDES VARIETY OF PROGRAMS PRIMARILY OFFERED TO SCHOOL GROUPS, GENERALLY FOR FIVE-DAY RESIDENTIAL CAMPING SESSIONS, SERVING ROUGHLY 32,000 STUDENTS PER YEAR.

Activity3.Description: CHEWONKI SEMESTER SCHOOL - SEMESTER-LONG RESIDENTIAL PROGRAM OFFERED TO ELEVENTH GRADE STUDENTS, SERVING ROUGHLY 80 STUDENTS PER YEAR.

ActivityOther.Description: Includes store activity, sustainability program and farm operations.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Effective September 1, 2009 the Organization adopted the provisions of Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes as provided for in the Income Taxes topic of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification (formerly, FIN 48). This implementation had no material impact on the Organization's financial statements. There was no cumulative effect on the Organization's financial statements related to the adoption of these provisions, and no interest or penalties related to uncertain tax positions were accrued. The Organization is currently open to audit under the statute of limitations by the Internal Revenue Service and state taxing authorities for the years ended August 31, 2007 through 2010.
Unrealized Gain on Investments: 129631. Extraordinary loss on asset impairment: -163197.
Extraordinary loss on asset impairment: -163197. Revenue associated with Big Eddy Campground, Inc. : 48109.
Program expenses associated with Big Eddy Campground, Inc.: 48109.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: Financial aid awarded to participants in various programs offered by the Organization.
Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: Reduction of tuition due from recipient.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The Organization maintains detailed records as to the amounts of and reasons for financial aid awarded to participants in its programs.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Joshua Marvil and Rebecca Marvil both serve as trustees and are brother and sister. Additionally, Jean Wilkinson and Kate Wilkonson both serve as trustees and are mother and daughter.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 WAS PREPARED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S ACCOUNTING AND AUDITING FIRM AND THEN REVIEWED BY THE CFO PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ADHERENCE TO THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REVIEWED ON AN ONGOING BASIS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT IS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD PERIODICALLY THROUGH A REVIEW OF HIS PERFORMANCE COUPLED WITH CONSIDERATION OF COMPARABLE COMPENSATION LEVELS FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS IN SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS. COMPENSATION FOR THE CFO IS SIMILARLY DETERMINED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC BY WAY OF ITS OWN WEBSITE, OTHER WEBSITES, AND UPON REQUEST.
This process has not changed from the prior year.

Form 990, Schedule R, Part V: Effective August 30, 2010, all of the remaining assets and liabilities of Big Eddy Campground, Inc. were transferred to its sole shareholder, Chewonki Foundation, pursuant to a tax-free liquidation and dissolution of Big Eddy Campground, Inc. under IRC Section 332. The assets and liabilities thus absorbed by Chewonki Foundation had a net book value of $3,180 at the time of this liquidation.
Prior year financial data included within this Form 990 has been updated to correspond to final audited financial statements issued for the prior year.
